New Energy Bills Discount Scheme

The March budget saw the new âEnergy Bills Discount Schemeâ (EBDS) introduced to replace the âEnergy Bill Relief Schemeâ (EBRS) that had run until 31st March. The Energy Bills Discount Scheme will run for 12 months, from April 2023 to the end of March 2024.

The EBDS contains a baseline discount that will provide some support with energy bills for eligible non-domestic customers. This discount will be applied automatically and non-domestic users should expect to see this applied in May bills. There are also additional discounts for non-domestic users in certain sectors.

For more information on the EBRS, go to the UK Government website.

Deposit Return Scheme delayed

Plans to introduce a Deposit Return Scheme for single-use drinks containers in Scotland have been pushed back from August 2023 to 1 March 2024.

Under the new scheme, when anyone buys a drink they pay a 20p deposit for the bottle or can it comes in, which they get back when they return their empty bottle or can to a collection point to be recycled. The scheme has been designed to help tackle climate change by reducing the amount of material going to landfill, improving recycling rates and reducing litter.

Drink producers, importers, wholesalers and retailers all have obligations under The Deposit and Return Scheme for Scotland Regulations 2020.

Zero Waste Scotland has compiled a list of Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) on the Scheme, including why Scotland is introducing it and how it actually works for businesses.

Read the FAQs here: depositreturnscheme.zerowastescotland.org.uk/faqs

Regional Energy Masterplan

South Ayrshire Council, along with North and East Ayrshire Councils, have partnered with Scottish Enterprise and the University of the West of Scotland to create a Regional Energy Masterplan for Ayrshire. The work that is now underway will produce:

An assessment of how energy is used across the region

Identification of energy sources

Development of a strategic energy vision for all of Ayrshire

Option evaluations

Planning, scenario modelling, and reporting of proposed technical solutions

Options to identify opportunities for investment, business growth, skills and supply chain development at the regional level

This work will support options in energy infrastructure investments for Ayrshire and will catalyse the use of new clean/low carbon technologies which can lead to economic growth, community wealth building and help our region be more resilient to climate change.

Weâll continue to provide updates as the project progresses.
